title: W3.JS Http Requests

metadata.description: Learn about W3.JS Http Requests with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Read data from servers: w3.getHttpObject( file .js, function ) The examples on this page are the same as the examples on the except that the data are requested from a web server: customers.js Filling a Dropdown Example With CSS » Filling a List Example
  • {{CustomerName}}
With CSS » Filling a Table Example
Customer City Country
{{CustomerName}} {{City}} {{Country}}
With CSS » Filling Another Table Example
Title Artist Price
{{title}} {{artist}} {{price}}
With CSS » ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
<select id="id01">
<option w3-repeat="customers">{{CustomerName}}</option>
</select>
<script>
w3.getHttpObject("customers.js", myFunction);
function myFunction(myObject) {
w3.displayObject("id01", myObject);
}
</script>

practice_exercises.solution:
<select id="id01">
<option w3-repeat="customers">{{CustomerName}}</option>
</select>
<script>
w3.getHttpObject("customers.js", myFunction);
function myFunction(myObject) {
w3.displayObject("id01", myObject);
}
</script>

summary: This tutorial covers W3.JS Http Requests concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use W3.JS Http Requests effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of W3.JS Http Requests and how to apply it in your projects.
